business.headline: Can RBI's liquidity boost give the sinking rupee a lifeboat?Liquidity can calm markets, not rewrite global conditions. As the rupee battles external shocks, will the RBI's latest push prove enough to anchor sentiment or simply slow an inevitable slide?

Noose tightens around Anil Ambani's Reliance Power as ED files chargesheetThe money laundering case is linked to the issuance of an alleged fake bank guarantee of Rs 68 crore for securing a Solar Energy Corporation of India tender.

Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Lower lending rates ahead? From ICICI to SBI, your home loan rate checkIndia's central bank has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points. This move is likely to influence home loan interest rates and stimulate activity across the housing and real estate sectors.

Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit in $72 billion dealNetflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film and streaming businesses, bringing the iconic studio under its control.

India's forex reserves decline for second week to $686.2 billion: ReportIndia's foreign exchange reserves fell for the second consecutive week, slipping by $1.877 billion to $686.227 billion in the week ended November 28, 2025.

Rs 1.2 lakh invested, only Rs 10,000 earned? The truth behind SIP mathsInvestors often overlook the real timeline of their investments when assessing SIP returns. Understanding the compounding effect and the actual period money stays invested can make a significant difference in evaluating returns.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as RBI cuts lending rate, offers liquidity supportThe Sensex ended at 85,712.37, up 447.05 points, while the Nifty50 settled at 26,186.45, gaining 152.70 points. Most of the broader market indices also ended the trading session on a positive note.

Victim of regulatory vacuum: Avadhut Sathe Training Academy denies allegationsSebi's interim order said the academy and its founder were running an unregistered investment advisory service under the guise of training programmes and had collected large sums of money from the public.

IndiGo flight cancellations: What passengers need to know about refundsIndiGo has informed the DGCA that full operational stabilisation is expected only by February 10, 2026, with continued cancellations anticipated until December 8.​

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Will personal loans become cheaper after the RBI's latest repo rate cut?Are borrowers finally set to get some relief as the RBI trims the repo rate by 25 basis points? Could this policy shift translate into lower personal loan rates soon? Read here.
Your FD investments to take a hit as RBI cuts repo rateIs your FD income set to shrink as banks prepare to reduce deposit rates after the RBI's rate cut? Let's have a look.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

IndiGo shares tumble 2% as mass flight cancellations continue to disrupt travel IndiGo's stock fell over 2%, trading at Rs 5,326.35 by 10 am, amid mounting concerns over ongoing mass cancellations and delays across India's busiest airports.

RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 points to 5.25%, maintains neutral stanceThe rate cut takes the repo rate down from 5.5% to 5.25%. Alongside this, the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) rate has been adjusted to 5%, while the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF) rate and the bank rate now stand at 5.5%.

Who is Avadhut Sathe, Pune finfluencer whose trading academy got banned by SebiSebi said that Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy was running an unregistered investment advisory business disguised as education, misleading investors through selective performance claims, paid WhatsApp groups, and live market recommendations.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors eye RBI's MPC decisionAround 9:36 am, the Sensex was down 60 points at 85,325, while the Nifty hovered just above the 26,000 mark with a modest 11 point gain. Broader market indices were largely in the red, reflecting the nervousness ahead of the policy outcome.

RBI MPC announcement today: Will the all-time low rupee force a rate cut?Earlier this year, the RBI cut the repo rate by 100 basis points across three rounds, supported by falling inflation. But the backdrop has now shifted.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19: Malti on equation with Amaal, and not bidding Pranit goodbye Actor-filmmaker Malti Chahar was evicted from Bigg Boss 19 following a tense fallout with friends inside the house. Her exit has sparked discussions about friendship and manipulation dynamics on the show.

Dhurandhar box office day 1: Film earns over Rs 28 crore as per official estimates Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar earned over Rs 28 crore at the box office per official estimates. The film is a spy-thriller also featuring Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal and Sara Arjun in key roles.

Justin Baldoni told pregnant Blake Lively he was circumcised; says she never asked Court documents revealed Justin Baldoni acknowledged discussing his circumcision status with Blake Lively during a visit to her New York home in 2022, a detail now central in Lively's harassment lawsuit tied to the production of 'It Ends With Us'.

Pardesi: An Indo-Russian romance disguised as 15th-Century adventure As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Pardesi (1957), a pioneering Indo-Soviet film portraying a 15th-century Russian trader's journey to India. Beyond romance, it symbolises enduring India-Russia friendship across centuries and cultures

Priyanka Chopra backs Janhvi Kapoor's message on equality. Read her shoutout here On Friday, Priyanka Chopra shared a video of Janhvi Kapoor discussing gender equality, using her platform to echo Kapoor's call for conversations and awareness around women's rights.

Akhanda 2: Makers apologise amid indefinite delay. Check update on new release date Nandamuri Balakrishna's highly anticipated film Akhanda 2, initially set for a December 4 debut, has been postponed indefinitely as the production team addresses unforeseen challenges. The makers have issued an apology to fans and committed to announcing a new release date soon.

Christopher Nolan led film body to meet Netflix after its Warner Bros acquisition The Directors Guild of America, led by Christopher Nolan, will meet with Netflix to discuss concerns about the streamer's potential acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery, following news of exclusive talks between the companies.

Schooled by Salman, how Pranit More turned humour into Bigg Boss 19 finale ticket After facing host Salman Khan's wrath on the first Weekend Ka Vaar for his "under-the-belt jokes" on him, RJ-turned-stand-up comedian Pranit More has turned his humour into his armour. Now among the five finalists of Bigg Boss 19, More went on to gel with his "group" and built rapport with his The Pranit More Show. He took stands against "bullies", and is now being backed even by some Maharashtra politicians.

Remember faces trying to fix: Sonu Sood backs IndiGo staff amid cancellation chaos Actor Sonu Sood has called on the public to treat Indigo Airlines staff with kindness and patience amid flight delays. He shared a video message in which he asked travellers to remain humble and considerate despite frustrations related to flight delays.

Ranveer Singh's flirty comment on Deepika's date night look steals the show Ranveer Singh shared a flirty comment on Deepika Padukone's date night look. The latter also shared a note on Ranveer's new film - 'Dhurandhar'.

Dhurandhar, Saiyaara, Pushpa: Why are our heroes toxic, broken, bad at boundaries A hard-hitting look at Bollywood's rising obsession with toxic, broody heroes, from Dhurandhar to Tere Ishk Mein. Why do audiences continue to romanticise red flags as passion?

Amaal Mallik's Bigg Boss 19 arc: Legacy, friendships, fights and finale Singer Amaal Mallik's journey in Bigg Boss 19 highlighted evolving friendships, rivalries, and emotional growth inside the house. He is contending against Gaurav Khanna, Farrhana Bhatt, Tanya Mittal and Pranit More for the coveted trophy.

Bigg Boss 19 Ep 104: Gaurav looks back, Farrhana cries remembering father Housemates Gaurav Khanna, Pranit More, Amaal Mallik, Farrhana Bhatt and Tanya Mittal revisit key moments ahead of the Bigg Boss 19 finale, as the series highlights emotional recaps, house dynamics and personal challenges.

Allu Arjun gave Rs 3.2 crore to Pushpa 2 victim, will extend more help: Dil Raju A year after the Pushpa 2 premiere tragedy, producer Dil Raju met the victim's father to address concerns over financial aid, confirming the assistance already provided and promising continued support.

Dhurandhar: Can Aditya Dhar-style cinema just be termed rage-bait or is it more? Dhurandhar portrays India's political trauma through unflinching violence. The film forces audiences to confront pain and seek justice beyond spectacle.

Oh. What. Fun. review: A star-powered Christmas caper that loses its way Michelle Pfeiffer leads Oh. What. Fun. in a festive film with charm and chaos. Despite strong performances, the film's script struggles to deliver emotional impact.

Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 likely to release tomorrow, Chennai theatre owner shares update Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 may release tomorrow after a Chennai theatre owner claimed issues are resolved, sparking fresh hope amid legal and financial delays.

Jay Kelly review: George Clooney's broken hero has shades of Imtiaz Ali's menRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025 Jay Kelly explores a movie star dealing with lost identity and fading fame, brought to life through George Clooney's honest, vulnerable performance. The film's quiet sadness and reflective tone will connect with anyone who knows the bittersweet side of life behind the glamour.

Aryan Khan knew The Ba***ds of Bollywood would hit big: Not arrogance Aryan Khan reflects on the sustained success of his first series, discusses his approach to creativity, and hints at future projects, while The Ba***ds of Bollywood continues to attract critical and public attention.

general news.headline: Opportunistic pricing: Centre cracks down on sky-high fares amid IndiGo chaosIndiGo chaos: In its order, aimed to protect passengers from 'opportunistic pricing', the Civil Aviation Ministry warned that any surge in fare levels from the prescribed norms would attract immediate action.

Biryani feast, Saudi clerics: Suspended TMC MLA lays 'Babri Masjid' stoneSuspended Trinamool Congress MLA Humayun Kabir laid the foundation stone for a Babri Masjid-style mosque in Bengal's communally sensitive Murshidabad amid heavy security presence.

3rd ODI Live: SA 185/4, de Kock hits hundred after Prasidh's doublestrikeIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) LIVE Score: Prasidh Krishna has taken back to back wickets in the 29th over, leaving South Africa reeling in the game. However,  that pressure has not slowed down Quinton de Kock, who has brought up his 23rd ODI hundred.

BJP's goal not just to erase Nehru, but to destroy...: Sonia Gandhi's rare speechSonia Gandhi underscored that while analysis and criticism of Nehru's contributions were welcome, deliberate mischief with what he wrote and said was unacceptable.

Netflix buys Warner Bros in $82.7B deal, what does it mean for youNetflix has sealed a historic $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros Discovery. This merger will transform the streaming landscape with iconic franchises joining Netflix.

Complete refunds to passengers by tomorrow: Government directs IndiGo amid crisisAirlines have also been directed not to levy any rescheduling charges for passengers whose travel plans were affected by cancellations.

Ex-Pentagon official says Trump deserves Nobel for uniting India and RussiaFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin says Donald Trump deserves a Nobel Prize for bringing India and Russia closer. He also criticised Trump's handling of ties with India, which have been rocky.

No calls, emails after work: Right to Disconnect Bill introduced in Lok SabhaThe bill proposes granting every employee the right to disconnect from work-related calls and emails beyond official work hours and on holidays.

How IndiGo's chaos is wrecking India's wedding seasonWeddings are built on months of planning and emotion, and for countless families, friends, and even the bride and groom, one IndiGo collapse was enough to bring it all crashing down.

IndiGo operations 'steadily' resuming, passengers' plight reaches Supreme CourtThe Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi issued a passenger advisory, announcing that IndiGo flight operations are gradually returning to normal following the airline's disruption, which resulted in over 1,000 flight cancellations on Friday and over 550 flights on Thursday.

Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Live: PMO in touch with IndiGo CEO, officials summoned, say sourcesIndiGo Flights Cancellations Live Updates: IndiGo faced operational disruptions for the fifth consecutive day on Saturday, with multiple flight cancellations reported across major airports, though Delhi operations are gradually stabilising. The Ministry of Civil Aviation has taken note of concerns over unusually high fares and directed IndiGo to complete all pending refunds for cancelled or disrupted flights by tomorrow 8 pm. On Friday alone, over 1,000 flights were grounded, adding to more than 550 cancellations the previous day. IndiGo acknowledged the chaos resulted from planning lapses during Phase 2 of the Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) rules, prompting the government to order a high-level enquiry to identify the causes and hold responsible parties accountable. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

Schooled by Salman, how Pranit More turned humour into Bigg Boss 19 finale ticketAfter facing host Salman Khan's wrath on the first Weekend Ka Vaar for his "under-the-belt jokes" on him, RJ-turned-stand-up comedian Pranit More has turned his humour into his armour. Now among the five finalists of Bigg Boss 19, More went on to gel with his "group" and built rapport with his The Pranit More Show. He took stands against "bullies", and is now being backed even by some Maharashtra politicians.

Big laugh, Vizag erupts: KL Rahul punches the air as India end toss draughtIndia vs South Africa 3rd ODI: KL Rahul was pumped as Vizag erupted after India finally ended their toss drought after 21 attempts in the match against South Africa on Saturday, December 6.

Putin's Bihari MLA: Meet Abhay Kumar Singh who added Indian tadka to Russian pollsBihar-born Abhay Kumar Singh, a medical graduate from Russia, joined President Vladimir Putin's United Russia Party in 2015. He became the first Indian-origin lawmaker in Russia after winning an election in 2017. Speaking to India Today TV, he recalled how he infused Indian-style campaigning into Russian elections, which helped him secure a record-margin victory.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Mother Russia in Moscow, Bharat Mata in Delhi: The civilisational bond beyond diplomacyThe idea of the Motherland runs deep not only in India but in Russia as well. The sculpture of Mother Russia visible behind President Putin during the recent interview reflected that pride clearly. It showed how strongly Russians connect their identity to the land, much like Indians do with Bharat Mata. History also records moments when this sentiment was defended, including the time Russia refused to sell the Mother Russia sculpture to the French President, saying it was not for sale. The shared reverence for the soil explains why both nations often find common ground beyond politics.

Video: Foreigner loses temper, climbs onto IndiGo counter amid flight disruptionsVideos circulating online show the unnamed woman losing her temper at IndiGo ground staff before gripping the service-window frame and pulling herself onto the counter barefoot.

Elon Musk pops the popcorn as Paramount vs Netflix for Warner Bros heats upElon Musk's reaction comes amid reports that Netflix has agreed to buy the film and streaming businesses of Warner Bros, which owns franchises such as Harry Potter and Batman. Paramount has accused Warner Bros of an unfair sale process.

World's first solar eclipse: 2,700-year-old text reveals ancient secretResearchers reveal 2,700-year-old records from ancient China that offer new insights into Earth's rotation and solar activity, confirming early descriptions of a solar eclipse and the Sun's corona.

Dhurandhar, Saiyaara, Pushpa: Why are our heroes toxic, broken, bad at boundariesA hard-hitting look at Bollywood's rising obsession with toxic, broody heroes, from Dhurandhar to Tere Ishk Mein. Why do audiences continue to romanticise red flags as passion?

World Cup draw or drama? FIFA hammered over event featuring Donald TrumpThe FIFA World Cup draw was heavily criticised after a stretched-out show that involved several Hollywood stars and Donald Trump. The FIFA president was slammed by fans and commentators across the world.

Are Himalayan towns ready for another Joshimath-like scare?Experts recommend enforcing strict building limits, stopping large infrastructure projects in the most sensitive zones, and mandating geotechnical surveys before undertaking of any scale of construction.

Dhurandhar box office day 1: Film earns over Rs 28 crore as per official estimatesRanveer Singh's Dhurandhar earned over Rs 28 crore at the box office per official estimates. The film is a spy-thriller also featuring Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal and Sara Arjun in key roles.

Justin Baldoni told pregnant Blake Lively he was circumcised; says she never askedCourt documents revealed Justin Baldoni acknowledged discussing his circumcision status with Blake Lively during a visit to her New York home in 2022, a detail now central in Lively's harassment lawsuit tied to the production of 'It Ends With Us'.

sports.headline: Mitchell Starc continues to rule Brisbane with batting heroics, goes past Broad Mitchell Starc continued his golden run in the Ashes 2025 with a well-compiled 77 that helped him add a new record to his name in Test cricket. Starc's innings helped Australia to take a 177-run lead in the match.

KKR power coach Andre Russell reaches 500 T20 wickets, joins Narine in elite list Andre Russell added a new accolade to his storied T20 career as he got his 500th wicket in the format during the match between ADKR and Desert Vipers in the ILT20 on Friday, December 5.

Shubman Gill cleared to play SA T20I series, gets fitness certificate from COE India captain Shubman Gill has been declared fully fit after completing rehabilitation at BCCI Centre of Excellence. He's now cleared to play in the upcoming T20I series against South Africa, beginning on December 9.

Sreejesh critical of India after Belgium shootout win: They will get a mouthful PR Sreejesh was critical of his side's performance in the quarter-final of the Jr. Men's Hockey World Cup despite securing a thrilling shootout win over against Belgium on Friday, December 5.

India end Washington Sundar experiment, bring in Tilak Varma for 3rd ODI IND vs SA: India have dropped Washington Sundar for the final ODI against South Africa, bringing in Tilak Varma. Varma last played ODIs in December 2023.

Big laugh, Vizag erupts: KL Rahul punches the air as India end toss draught India vs South Africa 3rd ODI: KL Rahul was pumped as Vizag erupted after India finally ended their toss drought after 21 attempts in the match against South Africa on Saturday, December 6.

AUS vs ENG: Star Wars' Stormtroopers back in attendance at Gabba Ashes: Did you stop the Star Wars stormtroopers at the Gabba. The 'GabbaTroopers' were once again in attendance in the Brisbane Test match creating an incredible environment for the fans.

Greaves anchors marathon 163-over resistance as West Indies save 1st Test vs NZ NZ vs WI 1st Test: West Indies secured a hard-fought draw against New Zealand in the first Test at Hagley Oval. Justin Greaves' unbeaten double century and a record partnership with Kemar Roach denied the hosts victory in Christchurch.

Did Hardik Pandya's return lead to Rinku's snub for IND vs SA? Irfan Pathan reacts Irfan Pathan feels that Hardik Pandya's return from injury has sparked Rinku Singh's snub for the India vs South Africa T20I series. Hardik is returning to the team after recovering from the injury he sustained during the Asia Cup 2025.

World Cup draw or drama? FIFA hammered over event featuring Donald Trump The FIFA World Cup draw was heavily criticised after a stretched-out show that involved several Hollywood stars and Donald Trump. The FIFA president was slammed by fans and commentators across the world.

From Brink to belief: How India's Juniors survived Belgium's vice-grip in an epic shootoutA storm of skill, nerves and sheer willpower — India edge Belgium 4–3 in a breathless shoot-out after a 2–2 thriller, powered by Tiwari's ice-cold strokes and Prince's heroic saves. The hosts now go up against the reigning champions in a thrilling semi-final clash.

Wolvaardt smashes record-breaking ton as South Africa crush Ireland by 105 runsLaura Wolvaardt produced a record-breaking innings as South Africa defeated Ireland by 105 runs in the first T20I at Newlands. She was adjudged Player of the Match for scoring an unbeaten 115* (56) with the help of 15 fours and four sixes.

3rd ODI Live: SA 185/4, de Kock hits hundred after Prasidh's doublestrikeIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) LIVE Score: Prasidh Krishna has taken back to back wickets in the 29th over, leaving South Africa reeling in the game. However,  that pressure has not slowed down Quinton de Kock, who has brought up his 23rd ODI hundred.

Shree Charani interview: Mentored by Mithali Raj, inspired by LanningIn an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Indian left-arm spinner Charani reflected on her journey in the Women's World Cup, where she delivered some brilliant spells. She also shared her admiration for Ravindra Jadeja and how Mithali Raj played a key role in guiding her along the way.

How can all-rounders like Hardik Pandya avoid constant injuries?IND vs SA: India all-rounders Hardik Pandya and Nitish Kumar Reddy have struggled with injuries in recent times. Legendary Jacques Kallis explained how the top stars can keep themselves fresh in a packed cricket calendar.

Discus thrower Seema Punia handed 16-month ban for failing dope testFormer Asian Games gold-medallist Seema Punia has been suspended for 16 months after failing a dope test, with her ban effective from November 10 as per the Anti-Doping Disciplinary Panel's decision. The National Anti-Doping Agency has not disclosed the banned substance.

Mohammed Siraj hosts Shami, Akash Deep, and Mukesh Kumar at his restaurantMohammed Siraj hosted Mohammed Shami, Akash Deep, Mukesh Kumar and other Bengal players at his Hyderabad restaurant ahead of their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. Bengal are set to take on Puducherry in Hyderabad on December 6.

Do or dew: India fight to keep history alive in Vizag deciderIND v SA, 3rd ODI preview: With dew dictating late-evening contests, India's fate could hinge as much on skill as on luck in Vizag. South Africa smell history, and KL Rahul's young bowling unit must finally deliver under the dripping pressure.

New Zealand vs West Indies, 1st Test Day 5 Highlights from ChristchurchNZ vs WI, 1st Test Day 5: New Zealand stay ahead but lose key bowlers, and Windies still have work to do. With Hope and Greaves resuming, the final day promises a thrilling finish with every result in play.

FIFA World Cup 2026 groups revealed: Mbappe's France, Haaland's Norway drawn togetherFIFA World Cup: The World Cup draw gave a big surprise to football fans as France and Norway were drawn together, which now sets the stage for an early Kylian Mbappe vs Erling Haaland clash in the group-stage.

Wearing 16, Prince Deep pulls a Sreejesh to power India to Junior WC semisIn Sreejesh's iconic No.16 jersey, young keeper Princedeep Singh delivered a breakout performance, making clutch saves in the shootout as India edged Belgium to reach the Junior World Cup semifinals.

Donald Trump awarded FIFA Peace prize at 2026 World Cup drawFIFA World Cup 2026: US President Donald Trump received the inaugural FIFA Peace Prize during the 2026 World Cup draw ceremony. FIFA says the award recognises his efforts to promote global peace and diplomatic engagement.

IND vs SA, 3rd ODI Predicted XI: How will India handle the Washington Sundar issue?IND vs SA: With the series tied 1–1, India face key selection questions ahead of the Vizag decider. Washington Sundar's role and Prasidh Krishna's form are under scrutiny as the team looks to fix its finishing and bowling balance.

India desperate to win ODI series vs South Africa: Assistant coach Ryan ten DoeschateIND vs SA: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate emphasised that the team is carrying a sense of desperation to win the ODI series against the Proteas, and will go all-out in the Vizag decider to turn their fate around.

Joe Root on maiden Ashes century Down Under: Clear plans, backing current formJoe Root finally ends a 12-year wait for an Ashes century in Australia with an unbeaten 135 at the Gabba, lifting England from 5 for 2 and reminding the cricket world why his clarity and class endure.

After Commonwealth Games, Ahmedabad to host Olympics in 2036, says Amit ShahAmit Shah says Ahmedabad should prepare for a bigger global stage as he expresses confidence the city will secure the 2036 Olympics after winning the 2030 Commonwealth Games, with major venues already rising.

What is Washington Sundar's role in India's ODI side? India coach reveals key detailsIND vs SA, 3rd ODI: India sheds light on Washington Sundar's evolving ODI role as the all-rounder sharpens his late overs batting and adapts to match-up based bowling demands, leaving his impact in the decider one to watch.

India rout Ireland 4-0 at Junior Women's World Cup as Purnima Yadav nets bracePurnima Yadav's stellar brace powered India to a commanding 4-0 win over Ireland at the Junior Women's World Cup. The dominant victory sealed a confident finish to their Pool C campaign in Santiago.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
